forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 54. Southwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 67, with temperatures falling to around 65 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 6 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn gently approaches Downtown San Francisco, the air is laced with the coolness typical of summer nights, settling at a tranquil 54 degrees. The patchwork of clouds drifting overhead hints at the transition to a brighter day. When the sun rises, it'll paint the city in warm hues, promising a high near 67 degrees, though the charm of the afternoon may coax temperatures back down to a soft 65, as if mother nature herself is tuning the day to comfort.

Despite the promise of a sunny outlook, echoes of the marine layer linger nearby. The familiar presence of fog whispers across the bay, stretching its fingers towards the bridge, but for the moment, it holds the horizon at bay, allowing the city’s iconic skyline to emerge in all its glory. As the day unfolds, the gentle southwest wind will be a companion, a soft reminder of the sea, fluttering around at about 7 mph with playful gusts ready to stir the branches and cool the skin.

For those savoring the morning, dressing in layers will be prudent, allowing a quick transition from cool to warmth as the sun climbs. Perhaps a leisurely stroll through the verdant expanses of Golden Gate Park, punctuated by a stop at a local café for a hot cup of coffee, would perfectly suit this serene summer day. As the hours glide along, the clear skies will yield countless opportunities, whether that be a casual bicycle ride along the waterfront or a thoughtful perusal of the diverse shops that dot the streets of the Mission District. With each moment, the joy of the day unfolds, inviting all to partake in the gentle beauty of the world outside.
